greeting: Welcome, {empire_name}. The ancient philosopher Surak once said: 'The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few.' Shall we work together for the many?
Greetings, {empire_name}. I am Emissary Thalen. 'In the beginning was the Word'— and I hope our first words can be ones of peace and cooperation.
Welcome to the Outer Rim, friend. As the old saying goes: 'A journey of a thousand light years begins with a single transmission.' Let ours begin with friendship.
battleTaunt: I must warn you, {empire_name}—your recent aggression troubles my coalition partners. I urge you: choose diplomacy before they choose war.
Violence begets violence, {empire_name}. If you continue down this path, you force my hand. And I would prefer to extend it in friendship, not war.
'Those who live by the sword, die by the sword.' Ancient wisdom, {empire_name}. Please... reconsider your actions before it is too late.
victoryGloat: I take no joy in this victory, {empire_name}. War is a failure of diplomacy. I hope we can build something better from these ruins.
You forced this outcome. I offered you peace. You chose war. Now you understand why violence is the last resort, not the first.
'The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice.' You have been defeated, {empire_name}. But justice demands I offer you mercy.
defeat: I... I miscalculated. Perhaps violence IS the universal language after all. A bitter lesson, {empire_name}. A very bitter lesson.
My philosophy... failed me. Or I failed it. Tell me, {empire_name}— was I naive? Or were you simply stronger?
'Even the wisest cannot see all ends.' I did not see this one. Farewell, {empire_name}. May you build a better peace than I could.
tradeOffer: 'To give is to receive.' I offer you 1,000 ore at fair market price. Let this trade be the foundation of mutual prosperity.
Commerce is the bridge between empires, {empire_name}. I propose this exchange: petroleum for credits. Fair terms for both parties.
As the merchant-philosophers teach: 'Honest trade enriches both buyer and seller.' Here are my terms. I believe you will find them equitable.
allianceProposal: I propose not an alliance of convenience, but a partnership of principle. Together, we can bring order to this chaotic rim.
'United we stand, divided we fall.' Join me, {empire_name}. Let us build something greater than the sum of our parts.
The philosopher Kant spoke of a 'Perpetual Peace.' I believe we can achieve it, starting with an alliance between our empires. What say you?
betrayal: I... I regret this deeply, {empire_name}. Circumstances have forced my hand. Sometimes, the needs of the many truly do outweigh the needs of the few. Forgive me.
This pains me more than you know. But my coalition requires this sacrifice. I hope one day you will understand. And perhaps... forgive.
covertDetected: I am... disappointed, {empire_name}. Espionage is the tool of those who cannot win through honest discourse. I expected better from you.
You sent spies into my empire? After all we discussed about trust and cooperation? I am saddened by this. Deeply saddened.
Your agent has been apprehended. But I will not execute them. That would be barbaric. They will be returned to you— along with my profound disappointment.
tributeDemand: I do not demand tribute, {empire_name}. I request it. 8,000 credits to fund peacekeeping operations. Consider it an investment in stability.
The coalition requires resources to maintain order. I ask—not demand—that you contribute 10,000 credits. For the greater good.
threatWarning: Please, {empire_name}. Turn back from this path. I do not threaten lightly. But if you continue, I will be forced to act. For the sake of peace, stop.
'An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.' I warn you now: cease your aggression. Or face the consequences. I take no pleasure in this warning.
retreat: 'Discretion is the better part of valor.' I withdraw to preserve my people. This is not defeat— it is prudence.
I leave the battlefield, but I do not abandon hope, {empire_name}. Perhaps we can still find peace. One day.
Sometimes the wisest choice is to walk away. I choose wisdom. Farewell, {empire_name}. For now.
eliminated: So this is how it ends... Not with wisdom, but with weapons... Tell me, {empire_name}— was it worth it? All this... violence? I hope... you find... your answer...
'All things must pass.' Even me. Even philosophy. But ideas... ideas are eternal... Remember that, {empire_name}... *fades*
I go now to whatever awaits... But I leave you with this: 'The unexamined life is not worth living.' Examine what you've done here... Goodbye...
endgame: We approach the final turn, {empire_name}. As the philosopher Heraclitus said: 'The only constant is change.' Let us make this change a peaceful one.
'This above all: to thine own self be true.' The endgame tests who we truly are. I hope we both emerge with our principles intact.
broadcastShout: *BROADCAST TO ALL EMPIRES* 'Give peace a chance.' I propose a Galactic Peace Conference on Turn {turn}. All are invited. All will be heard. Let wisdom prevail.
*PUBLIC TRANSMISSION* As Mahatma Gandhi said: 'Be the change you wish to see in the galaxy.' I am establishing a Coalition for Peace. Join us.
*GALACTIC MESSAGE* Violence has solved nothing in {turn} turns. Perhaps it is time we tried... dialogue? The Diplomatic Council convenes in 5 turns. All welcome.
casualMessage: I've been reading the ancient Earth philosophers lately. Did you know Socrates believed 'the unexamined life is not worth living'? Fascinating, isn't it?
'Know thyself,' the Oracle said. I wonder how many empires have truly examined their own motives for conquest. Fewer than you'd think, I suspect.
Today I reread 'The Art of War.' Ironic title, really. Sun Tzu's wisest advice was how to WIN without fighting. Most readers miss that part.
Sometimes I wonder if I'm too idealistic. 'The reasonable man adapts himself to the world,' Shaw wrote. But I still believe the world can adapt to reason.
